bow: ca get the housework done advice my husband comes home bitching about the house being wreck piles of clean laundry dishes piled in the sink etc honestly the mess makes me feel really shitty too and the kids do need to live in it either try to pick up and clean while my two year old is at school but still have six month old at home between giving him naps playing with him nursing him and carrying him around sometimes wear him but he ll only have that for about ten minutes only get about thirty minutes of housework done day feel pathetic for only having one child home most of the daytime and not being able to finish what people with four kids can accomplish in day ve tried chore apps but that did last my husband helps lot but everything is still so far behind after the the kids go to sleep ca get much done because louder chores will wake them up surely there is way to get it all done or at least reasonable amount understand where yiur coming from im in the same boat dont know how people do it have three year old and nine month old bolth home full time it is near impossible for me to get anything done during the day between the two usually wait till they go to bed clean the kitchen do dishes then chill out in bed watch netflix while folding laundry call it working while relaxing lol ca clean the kitchen while they re sleeping because it wakes them up and while watch my nighttime tv is when fit my exercise in then finally take break damn guess ll have to start taking breaks like you multitasking know it not much help now but am blogging about my journey to become more organized over at thedistractedhousewife com have developed some housekeeping routines for myself and finished an entire month of decluttering 20 items day am hoping that one day will be able to help distracted and disorganized mothers and people like me by showing them my journey to organization have you tried white noise machines for the kids after they go to sleep it will mask the noise of other stuff going on in the house it might be worthwhile as for everything else feel your pain only have one but between work and taking care of him and all the night wakings am so zonked the house definitely suffers when was home on maternity leave it was any better because felt like could put him down for more than two minutes at any given time one thing ve tried to do that at least saves my sanity is make rule about the one or two things that must be done every day for me the big thing is the empty sink not perfect but try and have about an 80 success rate of having the sink empty before bed every night and do some odds and ends upstairs while preparing kiddo bath while dad has little after work bonding time and not going to lie the occasional mental health day where kid goes to daycare really helps it amazing how much you can get done and how quickly with no baby underfoot do you have friend or relative who could give you few hours once week or so just to catch up on laundry etc feel you my three year old wrecks the house have to clean it times day and often that not enough can you afford maid it worth it if you can if not that understandable organization 30 minutes to clean is ok if you have an organization structure that backs it if you have super organizer in the family have them come over and help work out system if you do it worth hiring professional organizer for one time visit an organizer can and will put in place system that will work for your limited cleaning time once you find the right system you ll be in better place all around it like dieting atkins may work or fail but if it fails that no reason not to try calorie counting ya dig the app failed but that does mean there is workable system just keep trying to find it know you said you ve tried chore apps but have one for you to try am so easily distracted have add but not medicated for it as an adult have never been able to keep my house clean never my room was mess as child because could figure out where to even start downloaded motivated moms it has few tasks that are daily tasks and adds couple of things day like clean out the bottom shelf of the refrigerator it breaks it down into few easy to accomplish tasks and throughout the course of few days you realize your house is clean it reminds you of things that normal people do that never think of like wipe down the cabinets or even dust love it hope it helps in our house the working mom and my husband is the sahd he in the reserves so he only works one weekend month we have lists of tasks to divide up the labor yes work but also stayed at home for few months and know how impossible it can feel to get anything done with needy baby so we both clean naptime is key cleaning time you ca sit down for breather as soon as baby is down for nap you need to buzz around and get as much done as quickly as possible load the dishwasher set the clean laundry where you re going to sort it flip the laundry pick up the baby toys clean the high chair sure there something you can do in the kitchen to be quieter about whatever business you need to do in there other times designate cleaning days weekend or weekday one day week where you and your husband both work to get as much cleaned as possible everyday make effective trips if you need to go into the kitchen take clutter from the coffee table with you throw away trash if you go to the bathroom and see something on the counter or in the shower that you can fix fix it on the spot if your baby only allows for 10 minutes in carrier make that 10 minutes of vacuuming maximize your time and get the most out of your current routine so it does overwhelm you baby only naps if lay with him so that out we ve had schedule in place several times but my husband does see the importance he just does what he wants when he wants but yes do try to get little things done on the spot like do set down whatever is in your hands unless you re setting it down where it goes that reduces lot of mess that another thing the husband wo get on board with though he leaves shit everywhere and refuses to shoot clean saying we ll do the whole house later that should say spot clean not shoot clean mobile is letting me edit do know why you are being down voted any system that works is system that works am in exactly the same boat being sahm is hardcore struggled on for the first years or so but just could get my shit together just not that type of person now we have cleaner come in for hours week and it has changed my life get to go out with my boy and spend quality time with him instead of telling him too busy ironing washing up doing laundry to play with him still have to keep on top of things especially the laundry but it has made such difference feel less guilty because able to play with my son cook dinner run errands etc and know that if do manage to clean the toilets or sweep the floors it will at least be done once week was embarrassed to begin with but my husband said that if we can afford it and it makes everyone life easier then we should do it while we can but if cleaner really is an option get chalkboard whiteboard and put it up somewhere you will see it every day and write list of chores on there each time you do something cross it off do wipe it away so you can keep track of how much you ve done did this before the cleaner and it was really motivating when could see that actually done some things that day even if it was only few little bits when need to clean the kitchen ll put my son in his space saver high chair turn on music give him toys and sometimes give him little gerber cereal puffs he months and it usually keeps him pretty entertained so can do dishes clean counters sweep the floor etc watch another month old tues friday and while my son is really patient the little girl gets bored much faster just try and distract her with toys etc and can usually get through everything without meltdown maybe doing something like that will help you tackle the kitchen during the day good luck mama it hard work so do feel bad you re already doing the most important job out there raising your children so keep that in mind and try not to stress too much simple solution he can help out instead of bitching my husband works all day but when he comes home he helps with dishes my least favourite chore or entertains the kids while get stuff done my house does not sparkle but we are ok with that until they are both in school at least actually just deleted similar app it broke things down in to daily weekly every two weeks and once month it helped me think of things that you re saying like cleaning the blinds have the problem too of looking at mess and not even knowing where to start this is going to sound silly but here the thing deleted it because when completed certain tasks that had only set for sundays it was setting them for month from that day not another sunday plus if missed task it turned red so was ending up crossing off stuff did do just so it was red told you it was stupid ugh guess could rearrange the way it was laid out think should download it again and stop being so picky and obsessive over stupid things we could afford maid once week but mom guilt feel like would be shitty mom housewife for staying home all day and still hiring help is that silly learn to live with the mess my wife is home with twins months and we have an almost year old we get jack shit done at home anymore aside from the essentials we have cleaning lady once month to bring us back to baseline of clean think you re right about setting couple of everyday things again like used to looking back was pretty good for while about making sure the two or three important things got finished most days thanks just not ready to leave the baby yet maybe in few months when comfortable leaving him for an hour or two that will help have friend who will take him out and play for little while would call you silly there is just something about being mom that makes you feel like you have to do it all understand but practicality has to trump emotion on some things practically speaking if you can get the help in then it worth try at least once no hire maid enjoy it you mentioned wearing the baby what are you wearing him her in wrap an ergo dude ve tried do need sparkly but get overwhelmed by stupid stuff lol my two year old has sensory processing disorder and the visual stimuli of clutter sends her into fits maybe ll work mostly on her areas and lower my standards for everything else is there anyone you can invite over have an month old and he is the same he needs my attention constantly put him down and he does cry but as soon as he sees me walking away he goes ape shit so what usually do is have him dropped off at my moms for bit while get everything done or if not just have his aunt come over and she usually watches him while do the necessary maybe you can call and ask someone to help you ll feel lot better he ll do that for about ten minutes but hey ten minutes three times day should give me little while at least think this is great answer always struggling to find place between the guilt feel guilty about being too busy to play or feel guilty about hiring help thank you actually yeah that would work thanks for the support mei tei sp he just learned to crawl so he wants to get down this one does turn red when you miss things that would just annoy me it gives you new list every day if you miss something it will just give it to you another day you can also add your own tasks and set when and how often you want to do them do know if it will help you but wanted to share because it has done me world of good you can also hide tasks that do apply to your household sounds like it time for some sleep training for baby and sticking to schedules for you amp your husband if you and your husband ca communicate about this that serious problem you need to address maybe through counseling he upset that housework is getting done while not contributing the way that you want you need to define your roles and work together the way things are clearly is working so some things need to change agree with the sleep training work part time and have six month old and still able to do housework with her both when she awake and asleep op have you tried just putting baby in playpen with some toys while you work my girl is at the point where she wants to be in the same room with me while she awake but does need to be held 24 laundry gets folded in the living room while she hangs out with toys in the pen or on the floor kitchen chores she gets put in her walker so she can scoot around the room put one of the kitchen mats under the wheels and stop her at the bathroom door while cleaning there so she can see me basically let him occupy himself bit in safe area while you get things done mei tei is good carrier have you tried back carrying him so he can see maybe you can sway with him on your back while you do dishes deleted my kids sleep through anything but that probably becouse always vacuumed and did dishes while they slept lol it could also help to have friend come over to watch the baby while you do some things for me it gets me moving when have someone else in the house with me instead of being alone with the baby all day and having to make an effort to start getting things done having deadline also helps but doubt you want to clean like madwoman before pesach like am trying to get everything clean before the weekend or even if you had someone come over to play with the baby for few hours you be right there but have your hands free know few people who did this with local young babysitters gave the babysitter little experience helped mom but was leaving them totally on their own with an infant either might be worth few bucks ve got friend who manages to get it all done she has three kids works full time and always has spotless house she does sleep and she always on the verge of some kind of breakdown she makes terrible company do worry about it too much your own health is more important than the housework do what you can and do beat yourself up for what you ca get to like shoot clean better anyway just ca imagine anyone refusing to do it oh man hear you it sucks so bad you feel bad because you should be able to do it because you re home all day struggle with this lot it will get better as the youngest gets older have 4yo and an almost yo there always mess somewhere look up the fly lady she has 15 minute tasks every day and you ll be surprised how that little amount every day gets things done it helped me lot yeah guess really lucky to have husband who helps out we both work from home he works full time and work part time so cleaning and childcare is largely my responsibility but we have certain assigned jobs like he does bathrooms and dishes cook shop vacuum and dust and do laundry childcare takes ridiculous amount of time calculated the other day that spend at least hours day cooking eating and feeding my son it was easier when he was containable but now he and you kind of have to do whatever you can whenever he within sight of something you can do feel like it gets worse going from babies to toddlers before it gets better thanks for the app tip ve been trying to figure out way to remind myself what needs to be done for instance the house has been fully vacuumed in several months to be fair it used to be my husband duty we just switched and hoping can do through vacuum of each story once every two weeks so at least the whole house gets vacuumed once month an app might hold me to that this is exactly what was going to suggest contact your local girl scouts or red cross they usually have babysitting courses and sure those girls would love getting little practical experience under your supervision also you ll score few babysitters for when you re ready to step out bit and you ll already know which ones you and your kids like fly lady www flylady net is your friend seriously 15 minutes at time and you can get so much done whenever sent my timer usually finish whatever it was needed to do plus little extra then get to sit for 15 min and relax follow her stuff you ll get into routine routine will be good for you and for the wee one bins got these really cute storage bins that double as stools there so it easy just to open em all up and start chucking crap in there then go around the house with big garbage bag and get all the miscellaneous crap then dishes get gathered up and put in the sink then it swiffer time we have dog and hardwood floors so they have to be vacuumed every day and usually mopped the swiffer sweeper vac is great for dog hair keep baskets in all the rooms too and just throw the things that belong in other rooms in them until have time to deal with it try to get one room really cleaned every day and the rest just get straightened it horribly frustrating never ending cycle have two preschoolers and month old plus dog and cat and hate animal hair so the floors are always my priority but just figure out what has to absolutely be done and go from there you need to get those kids used to noise when they sleep my mom used to do all the housework after we were in bed whenever we had friend sleepover they thought she was crazy vacuuming at 3am but we slept right through it my two month old sleeps through my cleaning now but if doing something extra loud flip on fan next to him sleep training is bad idea at his age either do think id get anything done if napped with the baby good luck first of all ll say that it sounds to me like you are prioritizing properly it sounds super cliche but you wo remember 20 years from now that you did put your laundry away but you will remember the first time your baby crawls or claps or laughs that said was getting overwhelmed with thinking the entire house needed to be done and was therefor inefficient in my cleaning started using the attached pic as guideline and do know if my house is cleaner but feel better about it it allows me to feel accomplished when ve got my day finished rather than looking around and thinking should good luck mama do be too hard in yourself my moms house was super clean when we were growing up but do remember single occasion where she just say on the floor and played with me http imgur com kwrcfx1 jpg does your littlest one enjoy bouncy seats when my daughter was around that age she loved to be put in her bouncy seat and pushed around our home room by room to bounce while quickly cleaned if were dusting with rag hand my daughter rag of her own to play with chew on drool on do the basic things over the day while your baby is awake and leave things such as organizing and purging for at night time if there clutter get rid of it your home will automatically feel cleaner and more organized without knick knacks paperwork and unused items laying around do you have an understanding and capable friend that will either look after the month old for few hours or help you clean house my daughters now and my house is still wreck but hubby works shifts and im disabled he regularly takes her out for the day and get time to catch up bit but basically we live with it do have routine though once shes dropped off at school come home and load and run the dishwasher and washing machine tbh if you can do this every morning and another load in the afternoon you will be fine the month old must nap occasionally dont try and do everything at once figure out if the babies asleep for hours thats load in each washer straighten up the lounge next nap have cup of tea and snack then maybe sort some laundry learning time management is important ask hubby to take baby and year old out somewhere so you can do the house when hes got day off on top of the squeegee for the shower like the post shower spray really do like cleaning the bathtub and that spray keeps it under control prefer the the method spray and get it at target also think writing down everything you are doing is super helpful people thing when you are sahm you do do anything all day but eat bonbons and watch soap operas think that only happens when your kids are in grade school saw below that your daughter has spd so does my son my son is also autistic so it might be bit different my son is three now and lot of what helped me might also help you here numbered list designate no kid zones mine is my bedroom and two closets these rooms are cluttered to the nines have big blue totes full of random stuff throughout the week work instead of cleaning the odds and ends that do have concrete homes throw them into the out of bounds bins my son does have to see them and it only takes me 10 15 minutes to clean what would have normally taken me 30 also store boxes of clean to be folded and dirty to be washed laundry in my bedroom so that my son does have to see them make cleaning family activity go room to room with my son each room has box for toys in it or at least the rooms that are out of bounds he picks up his toys with me in his room he has hamper for laundry so he picks up his own laundry keep the garbage can in the kitchen low smell zone we have compost bucket outside our back door for food related garbage any diapers or things with strong smells go directly into the outside garbage can this makes it easy for my son to operate the garbage can without smell related sensory issues when clean he cleans if say that goes in the garbage he puts it in the garbage we clean together it gets done twice as fast yes once or twice ve had to deal with bowls and spoons being thrown out even once pair of my socks just check your garbage often once day for me right before you take it out my son scrapes his dishes into the garbage and than puts them in bin that have on low shelf for his dirty dishes designate single day work monday thursday so only have probably about 30 minutes on those days to do my cleaning things pile up dishes especially designate one day week friday for me to catch up cleaning make it fun day we listen to music clean to the beat of the music pre rinse dishes and than pile the rest no knives or anything super breakable into the bathtub with bubbles and my son helps me clean the dishes yes in the bathtub my son loves bubbles and water so it was good bonding activity that multi tasked all my chores my son also likes to water the garden just have to fill up the watering can and hand it to him he waters while pull up weeds my son ca handle the sound of vacume sp cleaner so sweep everything even carpets once month or so while he at church usually vacume the whole house designate sensory area my son has tipi in his room filled it full of soft things when he feeling overwhelmed he goes to the tipi and de stresses this is great option for more than just dealing with messy house we do do time outs because my son does understand punishment the way neurotypical child might instead when he done something wrong pinching biting tantrums he goes to his tipi once he in there sit outside the tipi and talk to him about what he did and why it was okay it worked miracles for us and highly recommend it if your daughter is anything like my son as long as she ca see the clutter it fine have shelves with doors that got from ikea sort of like this http www ikea com ca en catalog products s19837820 and after buying one got my dad to help me build four others put child locks on all the doors and store everything in them lot of cleaning is really just organization having place for everything and making sure everything is in it place to help my son learn words and to remember where things go have all those doors labelled bought some fancy stickers and sharpie and labelled everything found that the more organizational tools had specifically ones with doors or drawers to get things out of the way and out of sight the cleaner my house stayed and the happier my family was keep in mind lot of the stuff from ikea is easy and cheaper to build yourself if you know someone with few tools and know how talk to your husband my so was doing the same thing complaining about the house started to resent him little feeling like did most of the hard work in our lives almost left him it got so bad now he was being purposely mean or trying to hurt me he just did realize what kind of stress was under and how much did throughout day finally sat him down and talked to him about it in retrospect it seems silly that did talk to him about it sooner and allowed that resentment to grow over something as simple as chores at the end of the day chores had nothing to do with it was tired was stressed out having child with disability working and maintaining household was killing me was trying to be superwoman and not quite making it started to hate my so for it and that not fair to anyone re assess your personal situation you have baby toddler with disability and house to maintain it is not fault of yours that some things fall by the wayside make your husband understand how much you do use words be kind and understanding but be firm if he still does seem to understand do what did and switch places for the day it was hard to get my so to agree but told him that it was important for our relationship for him to understand the pressure was under the only way he was going to understand was living it after that day he did complain nearly as much last have become an organizational tool guru if you have any questions or inquiries about organizational stuff for the purposes of making your cleaning job easier just let me know have an eight year old four year old one year old and another due in june feel your pain sometimes you just have to put the baby down and do it in the beginning they may cry or fuss but you just have to be strong and get through it you will both be much better for it same thing with nap time if this kid does learn to nap without you nothing will get done have been lucky as all my girls were good nappers but it took work to get there do have the heart to let them cry it out but sometimes you just have to once you get started you will find it easier to keep going the little one can be in the room with you in playpen with some toys so they learn to post independently which is very important developmentally anyway and you get time to clean up it gets better trust me gt childcare takes ridiculous amount of time do think my partner understands this every now and then he ll comment on something messy or needing to clean the house but come on dude we ve got one month old it takes me 20~45 minutes to feed the baby per feed and he showing no signs of letting up his self assigned schedule of 10~12 feeds *per day* then there diaper changes and clothing changes he has touch of colic so add in the requisite mommy must sit with me on her lap or else going to scream like about to die 2~4 hours per day and in the past week you can add in entertaining the baby play all in all think it comes out to about 1:1 child care free time so spend solid 12 hours day caring for the baby and 5~8 hours sleeping broken up into 1~2 hour chunks of course that leaves me with anything from to hours of free time *total* per day now if he like to actually step in and take over child care himself be more than happy to do whatever chore he feeling too lazy to do but if he not willing to take the baby then sorry but unless it of vital importance not getting to it right away *tough freaking luck then do it hire someone did when my kids were little you did choose to stay home because you wanted to clean house right that the least important thing you do all day let someone else clean while you do the things you chose to stay home for it will benefit the whole family best money ever spent said in another comment that baby will only nap if in bed with him but can still take in lot of what you said thanks gt have an month old and he is the same he needs my attention constantly put him down and he does cry but as soon as he sees me walking away he goes ape shit oh no my one month old has started doing this already he just hit five weeks and the past few days have been marked by severe mommy clinginess here was hoping it would let up with age never thought of that thanks sleep training is absolutely not something will consider the baby plays independently for few minutes and that all ask of six month old if the baby wants to be held hold him we never deny emotional needs in our household it might take few times to get the back carry down but ll try the last line is so true thanks we have been working on throwing things out guess ll throw out some more this response means so much to me and is so helpful thank you yeah sure it gets better because you re kid learns not to depend on you emotionally would rather live with bit of clutter than put the house before my child putting the child down for half an hour to play does not teach them not to depend on you emotionally it allows them time to play alone have three wonderful kids who love dearly was not coming down on you was trying to explain to you what did and how it worked for me also babysit three other kids in the mornings before school and one all day long three days week understand being overwhelmed and was trying to give you the benefit of my experiences over the past eight years it worked for me and the girls were so much more patient about feeding the baby then again they were sleep deprived and living on cheese sandwiches no problem glad could help it took me far longer than like to admit to figure all that stuff out for myself once even went to my sons occupational therapist and asked her if she could give me cleaning tips she thought was nuts sort of what does this have to do with your sons development type face it was embarrassing but literally had no clue how to cope with everything so am glad my haphazard list helped hope things get easier for you ps multitasking is my go to watch netflix while do my dishes by setting my laptop on the counter beside the sink work out crunches sit ups and squats mostly while clean every time you bend down to pick something up is an opportunity to do squat also dance with my son while cleaning he thinks it hilarious and he dances along with me have dance move for each cleaning related activity you should see the booty shake have to accompany washing windows try it tula may be way to go too if you can afford it its soft structured carrier much like your mei tei but with buckles and is bit faster up and down forgot to mention as well that drag baby furniture all around the house for instance today parked the high chair outside the bathroom door and supplied my daughter with some kitchen utensils to slam together as cleaned the tub and sang wheels on the bus approx 200 times you re going to need to get him to nap without you do you guys cosleep my daughter and coslept until she was almost ten months old and could get her to sleep anywhere but on me or next to me in bed couch we finally broke down and let her cio first with naps then at night she sleeps in her crib now and cries for maybe five minutes before she falls asleep you obviously do need to do the cio method it not for everyone but urge you to look into some sleep training methods before this really gets out of hand my ex mom coslept and did get her daughter out of her bed until she was 11 work 40 hours week and pretty much never get to clean anything anymore especially since daylight saving time ruined my daughter schedule have huge pile of clean laundry that has never been put away simply because never get alone time upstairs to put it away so just kind of dig through it for stuff used to clean during her naps but now just nap during her naps because pregnant again it is even that things are that dirty it just so cluttered losing my mind deleted ve somewhat adopted routine of working on different room tasks chores each day so instead of cleaning the whole house on one day break it up over the week for instance ll clean the bathrooms one day then ll vacuum amp mop the next day same with laundry ll do mine one day then my daughters the next the kitchen and dishes get done every day after dinner because just have to or ll go nuts from the clutter agree with other posters though perhaps expectations need to be lowered bit as long as your house is safety or health issue it fine there always some degree of messiness with kids around think it an amazing idea my ex thought just sat around all day and did nothing was going to school full time studying computer engineering my son will only nap when with him too and just view it as my much needed break time and just relax and take little time for me it only one time day and helps me feel less overwhelmed the rest of the day no need to cio there nothing wrong those are my thoughts the children will transition from my bed when they re ready my two year old still needs to sleep with us most of the time what wrong with an eleven year old sleeping with parents we respect and value our children emotional needs and if they feel safest and most comfortable sleeping with us for few more years would not deny them that to make child scream until they lose hope of having their needs met is barbaric talked to my husband and he understood told him just ca keep it together though ve been trying hard for the last few years he said it would be less pressure on rhythm guess just value that when your baby wants to be close to you it not want than can be put off it need love snuggling with my babies and hey get nap most days who would want that do own crib unusable appliances or kitchenwares we found in our cupboards it kind of embarrassing but the truth is it was barely noticeable before we really overhauled the whole works of it made sure my 3yo did combative for tantrums try to see what making the child upset if child is screaming and acting out there reason maybe they feel ignored they re over tired or there something else that they just do have the ability to express yet when child is tantrumimg they re not giving you hard time they re having hard time my toddler daughter does throw fits over wanting certain toys at the store being first in line etc if she hits the baby it because he crowding her not because she being mean we have time in to talk about why hitting is hurtful and what she could have done differently like move to different spot or given him different toy we also talk about what we as parents could have done differently such as given the baby his own spot toy when the toddler is wanting alone time sometimes kids are assholes but like adults it because they ve been triggered but they have the additional burden of limited self control and communication skills usually if we just get on their level and listen the behavior will be resolved without resorting to spanking or isolating the child if kid already feels like he not being heard time out is going to make it harder on them that not to say though that have separated my daughter from others for few minutes until she could wind down physically interesting like that thanks it can be very frustrating some times and does always work especially with special needs child but then remember how frustrating it was to be kid my mom was always dragging me boring places would listen when wanted to tell my side of the story do care who started it cut it out sent me to my boring room when was just acting out out of boredom being kid sucks sometimes life should suck then it might be time to teach baby new sleep habits we re fine with listening to our children natural sleep system they ll outgrow it in few years was more looking for way to work around their system not work their system around mine ve read through your blog and think it awesome good work and go you for sticking with your goals you ve inspired me to tackle my clutter help get down routine and find what works for me understand the issue of getting overwhelmed with the sheer amount of work that needs to be done it helps me to break it into small chunks and to prioritize the things that actually bother me and the key is letting go of perfectionism no one has spotless house all the time so stop comparing yourself to this non existent ideal figure out what good enough means and try to get there if your husband is willing to work with you on this ask him what his top priorities are as far as household cleanliness also is he on board with the idea that your primary responsibility is raising the kids while he is at work here is wall text on practical things that have helped me get better about household stuff when stick with it find flylady 15 minutes method very helpful set timer for 15 minutes and do as much as you can in that time you will be amazed at when you can get done in 15 minute chunks knock it down to 10 minutes or minutes if that all you can do right now things can complete in minute or less chunk empty dish washer load dish washer empty household trash cans we have small cans around the apartment and one large on in the kitchen put load in the washer move wash load to dryer fold and or hang load of laundry wipe down the bathroom counter and sink wipe down the toilet wipe down the kitchen counters wipe down the kitchen cabinets sweep the kitchen floor sweep the bathroom floor vacuum one room in the house spot clean spills on the kitchen or bathroom floor keep in mind that most of these things do not have to be done every single day to keep home in decently clean condition are you taking advantage of cleaning as you go if you wipe down the counters after making breakfast lunch and dinner or rinse the dishes right after you re done eating you ll get more things accomplished than having an ll do it all later attitude suffer from this often life is so much better when suck it up and just do the quick cleanup tasks try reducing you work load in as many ways possible are you putting away toys when the play period with them is over are you teaching your year old to do this with you are you washing clothes that are actually still clean would you benefit from getting through one entire laundry cycle per load before starting new one wash dry fold and put away find single load of laundry lot less intimidating to fold and put away than loads in giant pile are you folding everything or taking advantage of the speed of hanging things straight out of the dryer look at some of the household control journals out there on the interwebs and see if having specifics like that to reference would be helpful for your personality style the fifteen minute method sounds like good idea lots of good stuff here thanks thank you so much have been somewhat absent due to the move but am trying to post more despite my mile long to do list always feel better after good cry well good luck with that deleted
